thread.section_title: 45: A daily diary of the Donald Trump administration transition - POLITICO
thread.title: 45 After Dark: Price Choppers edition
thread.title_full: 45 After Dark: Price Choppers edition - POLITICO

author: politico.com
title: 45 After Dark: Price Choppers edition
text:
Democrats focused all the fire they could muster on Donald Trump’s pick to lead the Department of Health and Human Services. Senate Democrats unleashed a scathing attack on Georgia Rep. Tom Price, ripping him for stock trades and “sweetheart deals.” But Price endured, surviving “a contentious hearing that seemed designed to slow, if not stall, his confirmation to a role in which he will help dismantle the Affordable Care Act,” POLITICO’s Dan Diamond reports .
Republicans are confident Price will emerge unharmed from the confirmation process, Dan notes, but Democrats smell blood: “continu[ing] their attacks on what they call his conflicts of interest, challenging him to explain why he traded stocks worth more than $300,000 over the last four years and raising new issues, such as his purchase of tobacco company stock as a physician” ahead of another, more important hearing next week.
While Price labored, Trump himself is preparing for an inaugural address that is now a little more than 24 hours away. As he does so, POLITICO Magazine reconvened his biographers to examine what they’ve seen so far, since he went from candidate to president-elect.
The consensus: This looks familiar.
